task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robot arm. The robot locates, approaches, grasps, lifts, and retreats with the red object.

task_long_description.overview: The episode shows a stationary robot arm tasked to pick up a small red cylindrical object positioned on a table, surrounded by blue markers. The robot first perceives and locates the red object, sequentially approaches it, opens its gripper, and aligns above the object. It then grasps the object by closing the gripper, verifies grasp success, and lifts the object from the table. The task concludes with the robot retreating after the pickup. The environment is uncluttered except for blue tape markers used for calibration or reference. The instruction and visual evidence fully align: no place or transfer occurs, only pickup.
preconditions: Red object is present and visible on table
Robot arm powered and in starting position
stepwise_plan: If necessary, scan for red object until it is visible
Detect precise location of red object
Move above red object at a safe offset
Approach and align with the red object
Close gripper with sufficient force to grasp
Verify the red object is in gripper
Raise the held red object above table
success_criteria: Red object securely held in gripper
Red object visibly lifted from table
Robot arm does not cause collisions
failure_and_recovery: Red object not found: retry scan for up to 3 attempts
Failed grasp: re-align and retry approach/grasp
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the red object is lifted and robot has retreated safely.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is currently visible to sensors
Actively scans the workspace for the red object
Moves gripper above red object, offset in z
Approaches red object and aligns within specified tolerance
Closes gripper with moderate force to grasp object
Checks that the object is secured in the gripper
Raises the grasped object above the table

recovery_strategy: Retry scan for object visibility up to 3 times
Abort and halt if collision detected
assumptions: Instruction matches episode: only pickup occurs, no place/transfer.
Red object clearly visible and accessible per all frames.
Object name in BT ('red_object') inferred from visual evidence.
Blue markers are ignored; table is flat and uncluttered.
Gripper force bin (10) chosen as moderate in absence of 'gently/firmly' modals.

expected_success_criteria: Red object lifted and held securely
